content: In what year did the construction of the Berlin Wall begin?

The construction of the Berlin Wall began in 1961. The wall was erected by the government of the German Democratic Republic (GDR, East Germany) starting on August 13, 1961, to prevent the东逃 of East Germans to West Germany, including West Berlin. The wall was a symbol of the Cold War and its fall in 1989 marked a significant event leading to the reunification of Germany in 1990.
